metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4385 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in dbFree in fs/jfs/jfs_dmap.c in the journaling file system (JFS) in the Linux Kernel. This issue may allow a local attacker to crash the system due to a missing sanity check. It was discovered that the JFS file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate memory allocations in certain situations, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious JFS image that, when mounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4385` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1123-aws - 4.4.0-1123.129
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1150-azure - 4.15.0-1150.165~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-lowlatency - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1150-azure - 4.15.0-1150.165~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-lowlatency - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.129').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1150.165~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1150.165~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1').
